title: STOP USING ******* LOLCOUNTER
body:
JUST PLAY A CHAMPION YOU CAN PLAY. STOP USING THAT CANCEROUS SITE.

SKILL IS MORE IMPORTANT THAN ******* COUNTERS.

replies.body: Sometimes it can be helpful, what needs to be done is people need to go to lolcounter, see the counters and not go "oh that's the top counter i'll do that" but go "this is the 4-5th counter, and i can play that champion with some skill, so lets go"

true. Plus Garen counters everyone, so just pick Garen.

{{champion:86}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:86}} {{champion:86}}
On some real %%%%, if you have to go top lane and you have no idea what you're doing just pick Irelia, %%%%ing stupid champion.

I would argue for days on how untrue this is. Irelia is not as easy as she seems. Some champions don't require too much game knowledge to play well, but you really gotta know what you're doing with Irelia. Plus Spell Weaving for Tri-Force procs, timing stun, finding low minions to Q on and AA cancelling are all essential to doing good on Irelia. If you wanted easiest top laner.

{{champion:80}} {{champion:80}} {{champion:80}}

As someone who mains top lane i can safely say you are wrong, she is easy.

Pantheon is a %%%% top laner, i make them my %%%%%.

Nah. Same thing with Ryze man, no skillshots, faceroll and win, but if you tried to 1v1 a Riven at level 3 thinking "Oh I have a Snare,MR Shred and Damage", you'll get yourself killed. Like I said, nothing complicated about Irelia's kit, it's all about game knowledge and knowing your power spikes and how to properly combo with her.

You don't seem to understand the point of the site, similar to the players who just assume that lane counters automatically win games. For example, there are 4-5 champions I like to play in the top lane. If the enemy team picks Rumble I can open up lolcounter and say, "Oh, Cho'Gath counters Rumble? Well he's one of my strongest top laners anyway so it would be a good idea to pick him and take the easy matchup."

yeah but it kind of takes the zest out of it. 
i mean you aren't *really*  earning your level/rank up benefits with a tool like that it seems.
